snippet: The central bank said it could draw on a pool of 1 trillion euros of securities tied to bank loans, but analysts expect it to buy maybe a fifth of that.
abstract: European Central Bank announces that plan to buy private sector assets will have a 'significant impact' on the eurozone economy, and could draw on a pool of 1 trillion euros, or about $1.26 trillion, of securities; European stocks continue to slump nonetheless, reflecting apparent investor frustration that program will not be more ambitious.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Naples.

lead_paragraph: The central bank said it could draw on a pool of 1 trillion euros of securities tied to bank loans, but analysts expect it to buy maybe a fifth of that.

headline.main: E.C.B. Says Impact of Asset-Buying Plan Will Be ‘Significant,’ but Does Not Detail Size
headline.print_headline: E.C.B. Says Asset-Buying Will Be ‘Significant,’ but Does Not Detail Size
